page.title: 09TYSOE FLOWER SHOW AND FETE
page.content: Is held every year on the Recreation field in the month of August, and is opened by a prominent member of the public. Marquees are erected, produce, flowers, cookery, and floral arrangements are displayed and judged. There are also classes for potatoes, carrots, peas, beans, onions, cabbage, and other vegetables. The first three in every class have a small prize. Apart from this other entertainment is provided. Stall holders are able to sell items of their choice. For children, Punch and Judy shows, a bouncing castle, and swings. A contest for boys is a six-a-side football game. the winning side being given a silver cup. The day ends with the raffle prize being drawn, and silver cups being presented to produce winners.
